statement.tex: %text If $\int_0^1 (3x^2 + 2x + k)\cdot dx = 0$, then find the value of $k$ %

reason.tex:
All that is required is the basic result \[\qquad \int x^n\cdot dx = \frac{x^{n+1}}{n+1}\]
And we get \begin{align} A &= \int_0^1 \left(3x^2 + 2x +k \right)\cdot dx \\ &= \left[3 \frac{x^3}{3} + 2 \frac{x^2}{2} + kx \right]_0^1 \\ &= \left[x^3+x^2 + kx \right]_0^1 \\ \therefore A &= 0 \implies \left(1+1+k \right) = 0 \\ \implies k &= -2 \end{align}
